src:
Presidente de Cuba ratifica respaldo a su homólogo boliviano
06 Nov 2019, 08:56 by Prensa Latina

El presidente de Cuba, Miguel Díaz-Canel, reafirmó hoy su respaldo a la gestión de su homólogo boliviano, Evo Morales, reelecto el pasado 20 de octubre para un nuevo mandato.

Adelante hermano Presidente @evoespueblo. Los pueblos de América Latina están contigo, escribió en su cuenta @DiazCanelB.
Desde su llegada a la presidencia, Morales impulsó diversos programas sociales y entre sus iniciativas destaca la nacionalización de recursos naturales, antes en manos de empresas extranjeras.
Las políticas implementadas por su gobierno permitieron una reducción significativa de los niveles de pobreza y una mayor redistribución de la riqueza.
Su programa gubernamental Bolivia cambia, Evo cumple ejecutó entre 2007 y julio de 2018 más de ocho mil obras en los sectores de educación, deporte, salud y agricultura, entre otros.
Sin embargo, la oposición desestima esos logros y se empeña en no reconocer los resultados de las elecciones.
En ese empeño promueve diversas acciones a fin de promover el descontento y tratar de desestabilizar el gobierno de Morales.
text:
President of Cuba ratifies support for his Bolivian counterpart
06 Nov 2019, 08:56 by Prensa Latina

The president of Cuba, Miguel Díaz-Canel, reaffirmed today his support for the management of his Bolivian counterpart, Evo Morales, reelected on October 20 for a new term.

Go ahead brother President @evoespueblo. The people of Latin America are with you, he wrote in his account @DiazCanelB.
Since his arrival at the presidency, Morales promoted various social programs and among his initiatives the nationalization of natural resources stands out, formerly in the hands of foreign companies.
The policies implemented by his government allowed a significant reduction in poverty levels and a greater redistribution of wealth.
Its government program Bolivia changes, Evo meets executed between 2007 and July 2018 more than eight thousand works in the sectors of education, sport, health and agriculture, among others.
However, the opposition dismisses those achievements and insists on not recognizing the results of the elections.
In this endeavor, he promotes various actions in order to promote discontent and try to destabilize the Morales government.
